page.title: 12Making films in FINTRY
page.content:
Partly due to the unspoilt scenery and absence of pylons and partly to its proximity to Glasgow (BBCtv and STV), the Fintry area has often been used for location filming.
This has varied from relatively small advertising work to major productions such as{"Eagle of the Ninth"}filmed on the moor behind Harvieston Farm.A Fort and Stadium were built, which could be seen from Aberfoyle, 15 miles away. A chariot race was shot in the stadium and the highlight of the filming was the finale when all was destroyed by fire. It was all greatly enjoyed.
Winter scenes in a Russian village have been made here, and once a castle exterior shot was used in a thriller, as a high grade establishment of ill-repute.
